resources.string: You Are Living On Borrowed Time!

MorbidMeter tracks your lifespan over an alternative timescale. For example, using a single year as a time scale and an estimated longevity of 80 years, a person in their 40s would have a MorbidMeter date sometime in the summer. Using a day-long timescale, the MorbidMeter time would be around noon. Fill in your name, birth date, and predicted longevity in years. Pick a timescale. You might want to know that the AGE timescale gives your age in total days, the PERCENT just gives the percentage of you life you have lived, and UNIVERSE stretches your life to the life of the universe, estimated at 15 billion years. You can reverse time and/or add milliseconds to some of the timescales. You can have multiple different MorbidMeter widgets on your screen with different parameters at the same time. Long press and drag to the trash any MorbidMeter widget that you are done with. MorbidMeter remembers the last parameters used when you start a new widget. MorbidMeter updates automatically every half-hour. Press the Skull to update immediately.
